name: fitr
body:
The `fitr` package is a tool for fitting reinforcement learning (RL) models to behavioural data. Currently, it's in early stages of development, and __only the Matlab package is presently functional__. 

Much credit is owed to Samuel Gershman for his [`mfit` package](https://github.com/sjgershm/mfit) from which the foundations of `fitr` are built, and from which I learned a great deal about fitting RL models. Currently, the `fitr` Bayesian Model Selection code uses many of the functions from `mfit`, but I am working on developing an independent implementation.

I am working on the python and Julia packages, but improving the quality of the Matlab version is currently my main priority. 

Future goals include:

* Documentation
* Built-in gradient computations for common models
* Bridging with tools such as SPM and VBA-Toolbox
* Expanding base of built-in tasks
* Improving speed by fitting subjects in parallel
* Exploring GPU-acceleration
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
